pros: The organization is small, which makes it a great place for an internship since you get to meet everyone and get a feel for how the whole organization operates. Part of the internship included coming up with a project to complete, which was exciting and made for an impactful experience.
cons: Very quiet work environment, which can be productive but also a little intimidating for a new intern

pros: great people, great pay. make great connections
cons: small office, competitive application (only take 2 interns per cycle)
